data.title: 135 French Words Used in English That You Know & Love
data.meta_description: Indeed, the English language has inherited many words from French. Here are some common French words used in English, that you use frequently.
data.text:
Dreaming of learning French but afraid itâs too difficult? Well, this article will come as a mood booster! Yes, we have great news for you: if your native language is English, youâre not a complete beginner in French. You know at least hundreds of words or more!

Indeed, the English language has inherited many words from French â 7000 to be accurate â and you probably use some of them on a daily basis. Even better, about 30% of English words come from the French language!

Thatâs right, if you need a good reason to start learning la langue de MoliÃ¨re, there it is. Discover the most common French words used in English, la crÃ¨me de la crÃ¨me du vocabulaire !

Why are French words used in English?

First things first. You might be wondering why English, supposedly a Germanic language, includes so many French â a Romance language â words? Well, you might not be of a curious nature, but I am. So I looked it up for you!

You see, following the Norman Conquest of 1066, England was ruled byâ¦ wellâ¦ the Normans. And they spoke an Old French language: Anglo-Norman French. Obviously, it began to influence the language of law, culture and administration in England. Long (hi)story short, centuries later, I can finish with âet voilÃ â, and you understand!

French phrases used in English

Letâs take a look at a few different areas that full of French phrases and words used in English.

Food

The words below are the same, or very similar in English. For more mouth-watering vocabulary, check our article on food and restaurants in French, and drinks in French. Bon appÃ©tit !

If you want to further expand your horizons â beyond the cul-de-sac â, check out this article on geography and landforms in French.

If youâre getting excited at the mere mention of French fashion, donât miss our complete guide on clothing in French. Jâadore !

Some of these words are chic, some will allow you to shine at social events, and a couple areâ¦ Well, let me just say, pardon my French.

Evening, evening party Evening party swaÉ¾eÉ

Appearances are deceiving

I hate to be a ârabat-joieâ, but unfortunately, there is a difference between French words in French and French words in English: the accent! Americans and Brits have their own proper way to pronounce French words, and most of the time, it doesnât sound French. And I get it, because French pronunciation is no picnic!

In fact, when I pronounce French words like ârendez-vousâ or âgenreâ with my French accent, my American friends donât understand. So I change my accent to American, and all is well!

Watch this funny video for concrete examples and donât worry, you wonât sound pretentious if you try to have a French accent!

French words in British and American English

If you already know these French words used in everyday English, you can work on your pronunciation to impress your friendsâ¦ or save the day!
